slides.alt: A glass dish with tiny pelleted lisianthus seeds in it. They're ready for planting.
slides.caption: Jan 23: Lisianthus and perennial seeds started.

slides.alt: Trays of soil with labels poking out, under purple grow lights.
slides.caption: Jan 25: Seed starts are under lights, just waiting.

slides.alt: A tiny green seedling poking up through the soil.
slides.caption: Jan 27: The daisy's were the first to sprout.

slides.alt: Larger seeds tend to lose viability sooner than the tiny seeds, and these 3 year old lupine seeds have gone bad. White mold is growing all over them.
slides.caption: Jan 28: Time to remove non-viable lupine seeds.

slides.alt: A cute, sunlit echinacea leaf sticking out of the soil.
slides.caption: Feb 10: Echinacea is starting to take off.

slides.alt: A tray of tiny soil blocks. They look like little brownies, but they don't taste like them!
slides.caption: Feb 10: Hardy annuals are starting to sprout.

slides.alt: A cute little lupine plant growing with it's tag in the background.
slides.caption: Feb 11: Lupine seedlings are the cutest!

slides.alt: A tray full of tiny seedlings.
slides.caption: Feb 15: Happy seedlings on watering day.

slides.alt: It's the biggest lisianthus plant I have, but it's still smaller than a pencil eraser.
slides.caption: Mar 3: Five weeks later... lisianthus grow so slowly!

slides.alt: Nearly 2 feet of snow on a patio table.
slides.caption: April 5: So much snow!

slides.alt: A bunch of fairly large goldfish at the surface of a pond.
slides.caption: April 10: First feeding of the season.

slides.alt: Plants growing under purple grow lights
slides.caption: April 11: These plants want to go outside.

slides.alt: A few plants growing in a tray.
slides.caption: April 11: Soil blocks make the healthiest plants
April 10: First dafodill of the season.
